1.title: Comfort Food

episode of.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (TV Series 2018)

1.plot: Tom meets the group of 13 dieters for the first-time over a reduced-calorie breakfast in one of his pubs. He sets out what they can expect from him and what he expects of them.

2.title: Quick and Easy

episode of.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (TV Series 2018)

2.plot: Tom shows the group of dieters easy recipes they can make at home including a 'cheat pizza', a pea and ham pasta and a low calorie French apple tart.

3.title: Special Treats

episode of.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (TV Series 2018)

3.plot: This time Tom offers his group of dieters a range of special treats, comfort food that is calorie-counted and tasty. Including a Mediterranean pasta dish and coffee and chocolate custard pots.

4.title: Takeaway Alternatives

episode of.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (TV Series 2018)

4.plot: When Tom discovers that a couple of the men in the group have been cheating by having sneaky takeaway meals he comes up with some tasty but healthier versions of takeaway staples.

5.title: Movable Feasts

episode of.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (TV Series 2018)

5.plot: Tom creates a series of appetising recipes to help his dieters resist the high-calorie options when they are at work. Packed lunches, mid-morning munchies and healthier snacks all feature.

6.title: Made for Sharing

episode of.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (TV Series 2018)

6.plot: After ten weeks the participants are hitting their weight loss goals and their is a feel-good factor among them. To mark the end of their time together Tom invites them on a river cruise with good healthy food.

imdb.title: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good
akas: Tom Kerridge's Lose Weight for Good (United Kingdom)
plot: Chef 'Tom Kerridge' (qv) recruits and mentors a group of struggling dieters, offering them advice and recipes to help them lose weight with long-term results.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
